column4: Sorry for doubleposting this, but it's really quite serious since it's actively preventing me using my system completely. Once my system has been up for a day things start going wrong - Firefox refuses to open, Terminal crashes on load. X-Chat is the only program I have open, and if I close it I will lose the ability to use it completely. Can I fix this behaviour?
I really don't want to reboot every day to keep my system working.
do you have firefox open when this occurs?
No. anto9us: seems to be.
keep a terminal open and wait until this happens again, then start another terminal or any other app from the already open terminal. this way you will see the error message

The problem is it's not something which just goes away. I'm currently in it, and I'd really like to deal with it so I don't have to reboot all the time. If it went away of its own accord I'd happily do that.
maybe you can try this already from x-chat: /exec gnome-terminal or something
No error message AFAICT from using /exec.
try /exec xterm if this happens to success you can try starting other things from it and see the error message
otherwise my only advice is reboot and keep a terminal open for next time it happens
xterm works.
okay try start gnome-terminal
I did. Still no error message.
did you get back a prompt without any message?
It opened the gnome-terminal window which hung instantly.
No errors on the console, just "Killed" when I force-quitted.
check resources from the xterm, like df -h and free -m
and the last few lines of dmesg can be helpful too
According to this I have only 100MB of memory free.
watch the second line that starts with +/- buffers but 100MB free should be already okay
and try starting other apps from the xterm, like gthumb, xv
and firefox
firefox just hangs until I hit Ctrl-C.
can you start xman? xmag?
